348.article_body: An Indian student has lost his life in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, the Centre confirmed on Tuesday. Some reports quoted his friends as saying that they had left for the train station to leave for Ukrainian city of Lviv to reach the western border. This comes as Indian Embassy in Ukraine asked Indians to leave Kyiv urgently amid Russian invasion.

349.title: Several injured in cylinder blast at maternity hospital in J&K's Anantnag
349.article_body: Several people were injured in a cylinder blast at Maternity and Child Care Hospital (MCCH) in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Tuesday. According to a hospital official, the explosion took place due to a leakage in a heating gas cylinder at the ticket counter. He added that the injured persons have been shifted to Anantnag's Government Medical College for treatment.

350.title: Congress didn't work for Manipur's development, encouraged separatism: PM
350.article_body: Congress party did not work for the development of Manipur and encouraged separatism, PM Narendra Modi said. "The people of Manipur have to be aware of this. BJP works for the development of the Northeast, especially Manipur," PM Modi added. "This is destroying their plans of divide and rule," PM Modi stated.

351.title: Nadal's will unquestionably be the GOAT if he wins French Open 2022: Kyrgios
351.article_body: Nick Kyrgios said Rafael Nadal will unquestionably the "GOAT (Greatest of All Time)" if he wins French Open 2022, adding that Daniil Medvedev is the best player currently despite Nadal winning the Australian Open 2022 final. Medvedev and Nadal competed in the final, with a triumph resulting in the Spaniard winning a record-breaking 21st Grand Slam title.

352.title: Mumbai Metro Line 1 achieves ridership of 70 cr commuters in 7 years
352.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Line 1 achieved a ridership of 70 crore commuters within seven years and two months of operational days, said officials. This achievement has been the outcome of "world-class service" and "flawless operational excellence", said an official. Inaugurated in 2014, Metro Line 1 added one million commuters from 20th October 2019 to 28th February 2022.

353.title: Delhi zoo reopens after 2 months, all 4,000 tickets sold overnight
353.article_body: Delhi zoo reopened for the public on Tuesday after remaining closed for nearly two months due to surge in COVID-19 cases. All 4,000 tickets were sold by 8:30 am after the link to book tickets was reactivated on Monday night. Only 4,000 people are allowed in the zoo from 8:30 am to 12:30 pm and 12:30 pm to 4:30 pm.

354.title: 2 men sexually assault 16-yr-old boy in Gurugram, booked
354.article_body: Two men have been booked for allegedly sexually assaulting a 16-year-old boy working as a domestic help at their house in Gurugram Sector-56, police said. According to a senior police officer, the house owner first assaulted the boy in an inebriated condition. However, when the boy approached the owner's friend for help, the latter too sodomised him, the officer added.

355.title: Woman stitches gold beads worth ₹18 lakh in burqa, caught at Hyd airport
355.article_body: Customs officers at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport booked a woman passenger for smuggling 350.00 grams of gold worth ₹18.18 lakh. According to the officials, she had concealed the gold in the form of beads, coated with rhodium, that were stitched on burqas. Meanwhile, a case has been registered against the woman, who had arrived from Dubai on February 26.

356.title: 3.5 lakh Ukrainians have entered Poland since war began: Min
356.article_body: Polish Deputy Interior Minister Maciej Wasik said that 1,00,000 people have crossed the Polish-Ukrainian border in the last 24 hours. Around 3,50,000 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on Thursday, Wasik told public broadcaster Polskie Radio 1. According to the UN refugee agency, more than five lakh people have fled Ukraine since Thursday.

357.title: Visva-Bharati students hold protests, demand reopening of hostels
357.article_body: A section of students at West Bengal's Visva-Bharati University has been protesting at the Registrar's office since Monday demanding reopening of hostels, holding of exams online and postponing of board exams. According to a protesting student, physical classes had resumed on February 3, however, hostels remain closed. "Students are facing challenges in attending their classes," the student added.

358.title: Man kills younger brother over fight with friend in Mumbai
358.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly killing his younger brother in the Kalachowki area. "(The accused) Ashok...killed (his brother) Akash with a knife after the latter fought with the accused's friend," Mumbai Police said on Tuesday. Ashok has been booked under IPC Section 302, police added. The siblings are residents of GD Ambekar Marg.

359.title: Alcohol consumers who help expose smugglers may avoid jail in Bihar
359.article_body: Bihar government is planning to grant relief from jail to tipplers if they cooperate with authorities in identifying liquor smugglers. The move comes as part of the government's crackdown on liquor traders and to decongest the jails. "We need to stop overcrowding jails and give legal relief to those who cooperate with us in tracking liquor traders," said an official.

360.title: President Ram Nath Kovind inaugurates 'Arogya Vanam' at Rashtrapati Bhavan
360.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday inaugurated 'Arogya Vanam' in presence of PM Narendra Modi, to publicise the importance of Ayurvedic plants and their benefits. Spread across 6.6 acres at the Rashtrapati Bhavan, the Arogya Vanam has been developed in the shape of a human sitting in Yoga Mudra. It consists of around 215 herbs used in Ayurveda.

361.title: Women don't get to play action-based roles, we don't get the budget: Huma
361.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said she is very keen on doing action films. "I enjoy doing action-based films," she added. Huma said that women don't get many opportunities to play action-based roles. "We don't get such scripts and neither the budget...If we do get such roles, then I'm sure we women are nowhere lesser than males," she added.

362.title: When there's a bit of extra pace, it's kryptonite for Shreyas Iyer: Hogg
362.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has said that India batter Shreyas Iyer is not comfortable against quicker deliveries. Hogg added, "When there's a little bit of extra pace, it's still a little kryptonite for Iyer...he tries to move around to put the bowler off." He further said, "We'll just see how he develops his game in the Tests [against Sri Lanka]."

363.title: Ukraine releases list of army losses suffered by Russia, says 5,700 Russian soldiers killed
363.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday released the list of army losses suffered by Russia, with its Defence Minister saying, "It's only indicative estimates. But it illustrates well the situation of the occupier. The enemy is demoralised, he's in agony." The list states that the Russian army lost 5,710 soldiers, 29 aircraft, 29 helicopters, 198 tanks and two warships among other things.

364.title: 'Kacha Badam' singer backs his car into a wall, receives injuries to chest & face
364.article_body: The singer of the viral song 'Kacha Badam', Bhuban Badyakar, met with an accident on Monday and received injuries to his face and chest. He was trying to back his vehicle when he rammed it into a wall in his native West Bengal. Badyakar was reportedly injured while learning to drive his recently-purchased car.

365.title: Nadella wrote about how his son Zain's cerebral palsy changed him in his book
365.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella in his book 'Hit Refresh' wrote about how his son's cerebral palsy helped him understand people of all disabilities. He wrote that visits to Zain's hospital gave him an outlook on how Microsoft technologies helped improve the medical space and that his work "transcended business". Being an empathetic father made him a "better leader", he added.

366.title: 7 women arrested for smuggling liquor in Bihar's Bhagalpur district
366.article_body: Seven women from Jharkhand were arrested for smuggling country-made liquor in Bihar’s Bhagalpur district, Senior Superintendent of Police, Babu Ram, said. The excise department was tipped-off that these women were coming to Bhagalpur on a passenger train for selling liquor in the garb of herbal items. The women were arrested at Sabaur Railway Station and 200 liquor bottles were recovered.

367.title: Sweeper steals ₹33 lakh cash at sub-post office in Hyderabad, arrested
367.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Sunday arrested a man for allegedly stealing ₹33 lakh cash at a sub-post office in Hyderabad. The accused, who worked as a sweeper at the post office, had allegedly broken the grills to gain entry into the premises, police said. After committing the theft, he set the post office ablaze, police added.

368.title: Bomb squad starts searches over reports of explosives at Gurugram home
368.article_body: After reports of the presence of explosives and ammunition at a vacant house in Gurugram Sector 31 on Tuesday, police started a search operation. Residents of nearby houses were asked to vacate their homes. The DCP Gurugram (East) said, "The bomb disposal squad is following protocol and only after their probe is complete, we'll be able to ascertain any details."

369.title: Ukraine warns residents of mysterious 'X' symbols appearing on buildings
369.article_body: The Ukrainian authorities have warned people to check for mysterious symbols on their buildings, presumably marked as targets for Russian airstrikes. Some of these symbols include bright red X-marks and arrows that have been spotted on rooftops and gas pipes. A Ukrainian mayor has also asked residents to paint and close access to the roof if marks are found.

370.title: Russian missile strikes near Kharkiv's administration building, Ukraine govt shares video
370.article_body: A Russian missile struck near an administration building of Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv. Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared a video of the missile attack. "Russia is waging war in violation of international humanitarian law. Kills civilians, destroys civilian infrastructure. Russia's main target is large cities that are now fired at by its missiles," it wrote.

371.title: Sister would've loved it and cried: Benedict on 'Hollywood Walk of Fame' star
371.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch spoke about her sister Tracy Peacock after being honoured with Hollywood Walk of Fame star. "She would have loved this...She would have just been laughing nonstop all the way through, and probably crying," he said, adding, "I hope somewhere up there, where the real stars shine, you're looking down on this moment now. I'm sure you are."

372.title: Rohit is amazing, he connects to every individual: Shreyas
372.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has praised captain Rohit Sharma, stating that the 34-year-old connects to every individual. "Rohit is amazing. He thinks from a player's point of view. He has got that mindset...I respect him a lot," Iyer added. "We have played together at the domestic level a lot...So, it's a good space to be around," he further said.

373.title: Australia facing more floods, droughts due to global warming: Scientists
373.article_body: Climate scientists warned that global warming is leading to catastrophic weather events in Australia like bushfires, floods, droughts, heatwaves and storms. This is leading to deaths, injuries, financial and emotional stress globally, they added. Many of these risks could be potentially avoided if we reduce our greenhouse gas emissions and strengthen our adaptation responses, they believe.

374.title: Video appears to show Ukraine farmer towing away Russian tank with tractor
374.article_body: A video has surfaced online that appears to show a Ukrainian farmer towing away a Russian tank with his tractor. The video was shared on Twitter by former Ukrainian Ambassador to Austria, Olexander Scherba, who wrote, "Ukrainians are tough cookies indeed." In the video, a man, believed to be a Russian soldier, runs after the vehicle.

375.title: Laser treatment mentioned in wife's termination letter was for a skin condition: Ashneer
375.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who quit the company days after his wife was sacked alleging 'misappropriation of funds', called his wife's sacking "not just injustice, but male chauvinism at best." Ashneer said, "In the termination letter, they have mentioned a laser treatment." He added, "My wife had a skin condition...that bill is a private bill. She paid for it."

376.title: Telangana budget session to begin without Governor's address
376.article_body: The Telangana Assembly's budget session will not have the mandatory address by Governor this year, as per notification issued by the state government. This is the first time that the Governor won't be addressing a joint session before the budget presentation. The decision is taken due to a face-off between CM KCR and the BJP government, a TRS leader said.

377.title: Rainwater on highways to be used for power generation across K'taka: CM
377.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai said that water flowing along the National Highways will be used for power generation across the state. The project will be implemented along the stretch from Karnataka's Kittur to Belagavi, which reaches up to the Maharashtra border, he added. "Robust development will be seen by implementing Jal Shakti project along all the highways," Bommai tweeted.

378.title: Medical student, 3 others held in TN for sexually assaulting minor over 1 month
378.article_body: Four persons, including a medical student, have been arrested in Tamil Nadu's Chennai for allegedly repeatedly sexually assaulting a 13-year-old girl over a period of one month. The accused also allegedly introduced her to drugs, police said. The 20-year-old dental student had befriended the girl through Instagram. Later, she was also sexually assaulted by the student's three associates.

379.title: Russia tells TikTok not to recommend military content to minors
379.article_body: Russia has asked TikTok not to show military-related content in recommended posts for minors. The Russian regulator Roskomnadzor said it had identified content on TikTok showing Russia's "special military operation" in Ukraine and a lot of them being anti-Russian in nature. TikTok has restricted access to Russian state media outlets RT and Sputnik across the EU.

380.title: Bitcoin briefly rises above $44,000 for the 1st time since Feb 17
380.article_body: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, was briefly trading above $44,000 for the first time since February 17 on Tuesday. It rose as much as 6% to $44,183 and was later trading at around $43,400. The surge came amid growing demand for cryptocurrencies following the Russian invasion of Ukraine and escalating sanctions on Russia.

381.title: Not a beggar: Ashneer on receiving any compensation after quitting BharatPe
381.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover on Tuesday resigned from the company. When asked if he was offered any monetary compensation by the board, he responded, "I am not a beggar. The board can't even look me in the eyes. I am not at their mercy. They are at our mercy." He also said that he'll be a shareholder at the company.

382.title: Do you think I listen to anyone's advice?: Ashneer on his decision to quit BharatPe
382.article_body: Ashneer Grover, while responding to a journalist’s query if his decision to resign from BharatPe was a personal one or advised by his lawyer, said, "Do you think I listen to anyone’s advice?...God has given me my mind and I have enough courage to take decisions on my own." He added, "I am Ashneer Grover...I'm not answerable to anyone."

383.title: Maha man gets death sentence for kidnapping, raping and killing minor
383.article_body: A special fast track court in Maharashtra convicted a 38-year-old man of raping and killing a two-and-a-half-year-old girl and awarded him a death sentence. According to the public prosecutor, the convict had kidnapped the minor, raped her and strangled her to death in February 2021. As many as 11 bite marks were found on the girl's body, he added.

384.title: Sri Lanka extends visas for Russian & Ukrainian tourists amid war
384.article_body:
The Sri Lankan government has approved a proposal by the Tourism Ministry to extend the validity of visas for Russian and Ukrainian tourists in the country for two months without any additional charges. 
This comes amid the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. There are 11,463 Russians and 3,993 Ukrainian tourists currently in Sri Lanka, according to the Tourism Ministry.

385.title: Sand artist creates Lord Shiva sculpture with 23,000 rudraksha beads
385.article_body: On occasion of Mahashivratri, Odisha sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has created a sculpture of Lord Shiva with 23,436 rudraksha beads. The sculpture has been made on Puri beach. The nine-foot-high and 18-foot-wide installation was erected on Monday. "A war is going on. We pray to Lord Shiva for global peace," he said.

386.title: Mamata inaugurates Kolkata Book Fair, requests peace outside Russian stall
386.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee inaugurated the 45th International Kolkata Book Fair on Monday. In view of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Mamata urged that no one should stage a protest in front of a bookstall set up by Russia. Police have been deployed around the stall. "Protest against war, but don't protest on the book fair ground," she said.

387.title: Indian grey hornbills released in Gir forest after nearly 8 decades
387.article_body: Gujarat forest department reintroduced 20 Indian grey hornbills in the Gir forest nearly after 82 years after they vanished from the forest. Ornithologist Late R S Dharmakumarsinhji had suggested reintroducing the birds in Gir as they play a pivotal role in the forest ecosystem, sanctuary superintendent said. They were captured from northern India and released in three batches into forest.

388.title: I'm stunned by your performance: Varun praises Alia for Gangubai Kathiawadi
388.article_body: Varun Dhawan praised actress Alia Bhatt for her performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Taking to Instagram Stories, he wrote, "I'm...so happy and stunned by your...brilliant performance and this beautiful film. Every technician, every person who worked on it deserves every bit of the accolades they're getting." Actors including Samantha Prabhu and Ranveer Singh also praised Alia's performance.

389.title: He is dangesh, not Akhilesh: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan
389.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that on one hand, PM Narendra Modi is running "Mission Ganga" to bring back the stranded Indians from Ukraine, while on the other, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav ran "Mission Danga" (riots) during his tenure as CM. "He is not Akhilesh but dangesh. More than 700 riots took place under his government," Chouhan added.

390.title: Central Railway earns ₹443.35 crore from scrap disposal
390.article_body: The Central Railway has earned ₹443.35 crore for the financial year 2021-22 up to February this year by selling scrap, officials have said. Central Railway's General Manager Anil Kumar Lahoti said the sale of scrap also helps in keeping railway premises clean. According to officials, these scrap materials include scrap rails, permanent-way materials, condemned coaches, wagons, locomotives, etc.

391.title: She was semi-conscious, said 'want to go home to protect Viku': Vikas on sister
391.article_body: Chef Vikas Khanna said his sister Radhika Khanna, who passed away on Monday, kept telling doctors she wants to go home "to protect Viku" even when she was semi-conscious. Vikas shared a video including several of his pictures with Radhika on Instagram. He also said that they were getting ready for her kidney transplant and that he was "perfect donor".

392.title: Alia Bhatt got paid ₹20 cr for 'Gangubai..', Ajay received ₹11 cr for his cameo: Reports
392.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who played the titular role in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' got paid ₹20 crore for the Sanjay Leela Bhansali directorial, as per reports. Actor Ajay Devgn, who played the role of Rahim Lala as a cameo in the film, received ₹11 crore, reports added. As per Moneycontrol, the film was created on a budget of ₹100 crore.

393.title: Mandhana scores fifty as India Women defeat WI in WC warm-up match
393.article_body: Opener Smriti Mandhana smashed 66 runs off 67 balls as India Women defeated West Indies by 81 runs in their second warm-up match ahead of the ICC Women's 2022 ODI World Cup. India posted 258 with Mandhana and Deepti Sharma crossing the 50-run mark. Pooja Vastrakar then picked three wickets to help India restrict WI to 177/9 in 50 overs.

394.title: GM, Harley-Davidson halt shipments to Russia amid ongoing war
394.article_body: General Motors and Harley-Davidson have halted their shipments to Russia amid the ongoing war in Ukraine and the resultant economic sanctions. GM cited "a number of external factors, including supply chain issues and other matters beyond the company's control". Harley-Davidson relied on Europe and the Mideast for 31% of motorcycle sales last year.

395.title: Death toll in Jharkhand boat accident rises to 14 as 6 more bodies found
395.article_body: Six more bodies were recovered by the NDRF on Monday taking the death toll in Jharkhand's boat accident to 14, officials said. "The first body was recovered on Saturday, seven on Sunday and six on Monday," DC Faiz Aq Ahmed Mumtaz said. On February 24, a boat capsized in the Damodar river in Jamtara district after which several went missing.

396.title: New York man wins $10 million lottery for the 2nd time in 3 years
396.article_body: A New York man has won a $10 million lottery prize for the second time in three years. Juan Hernandez had won the same amount in 2019, lottery officials said. "I'm still trying to spend the $10 million I won in [2019]," Hernandez said, adding that he'll be donating the money from his second lottery win to people in need.

397.title: Russian President Putin stripped of honorary black belt by World Taekwondo
397.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has been stripped of his honorary black belt by World Taekwondo in response to his invasion of Ukraine. Putin was conferred the black belt in 2013. "World Taekwondo strongly condemns the brutal attacks on innocent lives in Ukraine, which go against the World Taekwondo vision of Peace is More Precious than Triumph," it tweeted.

398.title: Germany to spend €100 billion on defence amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine
398.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Sunday said that the country would sharply increase its spending on defence to €100 billion in 2022. Germany's entire defence budget by comparison was €47 billion in 2021. Germany is sending defensive anti-tank weapons, surface-to-air missiles and ammunition to Ukraine, with Scholz saying, "There could be no other answer to Putin's aggression."

399.title: After Amul, Gowardhan milk prices increased by ₹2 per litre
399.article_body: A day after Amul increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre, Parag Milk Foods has raised the price of Gowardhan brand of cow milk by ₹2 per litre with immediate effect. "This price hike is being done after almost 3 years due to rise in costs of energy, packaging, logistics and cattle feed," Chairman Devendra Shah said.

400.title: Man slaps couple for objecting to abuses on road in Guj, complaint filed
400.article_body: A man, Nitin Bhojkar, filed complaint against unknown man in Gujarat after he slapped Nitin and his wife in road rage incident. The man's car overtook Nitin's car and stopped in front of it. Nitin was forced to apply breaks, after which man stepped out and abused Nitin. He slapped Nitin and his wife when she tried to intervene.

401.title: Ilker Ayci declines offer to be new Air India CEO
401.article_body: Former Chairman of Turkish Airlines, Ilker Ayci, has rejected Tata Sons' offer to be Air India's new CEO. Ayci alleged that his appointment to the position was "coloured" by Indian media, Bloomberg reported citing an email. Earlier, RSS-affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch opposed the appointment of Ayci, who was Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan's advisor in 1990s, citing "national security".
